title: Stratton Oakmont Steakhouse
description: Wall Street yuppie excess meets Miami Vice swagger. Where Gordon Gekko orders his steaks bloody and his cocaine pure. Greed is good, but the playlist is better. Power ties optional, power moves mandatory.

power_breakfast.title: POWER BREAKFAST
power_breakfast.description: Corporate Domination - Starting the day with market-opening energy

morning_trades.title: Morning Trades
morning_trades.description: Corporate domination with that market-opening energy. Every song sounds like closing a million-dollar deal before 9 AM. Music for hostile takeovers and hostile attitudes.
morning_trades.samples: "Money for Nothing" by Dire Straits, "Working for the Weekend" by Loverboy, "Everybody Wants to Rule the World" by Tears for Fears, "Take on Me" by a-ha

insider_trading.title: Insider Trading
insider_trading.description: Information asymmetry with synthesized superiority. When your breakfast meeting determines who wins and loses before the market even opens. These tracks understand that the real money is made with knowledge, not luck.
insider_trading.samples: "Owner of a Lonely Heart" by Yes, "Don't You (Forget About Me)" by Simple Minds, "Relax" by Frankie Goes to Hollywood, "New Gold Dream" by Simple Minds

yuppie_manifesto.title: Yuppie Manifesto
yuppie_manifesto.description: Young urban professional perfection with MBA arrogance. When your college degree costs more than most people's houses and you're worth every penny. Music for those who turned selfishness into an art form.
yuppie_manifesto.samples: "Material Girl" by Madonna, "Money Changes Everything" by Cyndi Lauper, "9 to 5" by Dolly Parton, "She Works Hard for the Money" by Donna Summer

corporate_raiders.title: CORPORATE RAIDERS
corporate_raiders.description: Hostile Takeover Anthems - Music for leveraged buyouts and power plays

hostile_takeover.title: Hostile Takeover
hostile_takeover.description: Ruthless corporate anthems with synthesized aggression. These tracks understand that business is war and war requires a soundtrack. Music for boardroom battles and insider trading.
hostile_takeover.samples: "Money" by Pink Floyd, "Burning Down the House" by Talking Heads, "Sweet Dreams" by Eurythmics, "Blue Monday" by New Order

vulture_capitalism.title: Vulture Capitalism
vulture_capitalism.description: Asset stripping with aristocratic elegance. When destroying companies becomes performance art and bankruptcy becomes beautiful. These tracks know that sometimes you have to break things to make them profitable.
vulture_capitalism.samples: "Tainted Love" by Soft Cell, "Bizarre Love Triangle" by New Order, "Personal Jesus" by Depeche Mode, "Policy of Truth" by Depeche Mode

leveraged_buyout.title: Leveraged Buyout
leveraged_buyout.description: Debt-fueled domination with compound interest intensity. Using other people's money to buy other people's dreams. These songs understand that the best acquisitions are hostile and the best profits are leveraged.
leveraged_buyout.samples: "Love Is a Battlefield" by Pat Benatar, "Final Countdown" by Europe, "Holding Out for a Hero" by Bonnie Tyler, "Total Eclipse of the Heart" by Bonnie Tyler

american_psycho.title: AMERICAN PSYCHO SPECIALS
american_psycho.description: Patrick Bateman's Playlist - Sophisticated psychopathy with impeccable taste

business_card.title: Business Card Envy
business_card.description: Sophisticated psychopathy with impeccable production values. Patrick Bateman's morning routine set to music. These tracks understand that murder and mergers require the same attention to detail.
business_card.samples: "In the Air Tonight" by Phil Collins, "Sussudio" by Phil Collins, "Hip to Be Square" by Huey Lewis, "True" by Spandau Ballet

dorsia_reservations.title: Dorsia Reservations
dorsia_reservations.description: Impossible exclusivity with homicidal sophistication. When your restaurant choice becomes a matter of life and death, literally. These tracks know that true power isn't just getting a tableâ€”it's making sure no one else can.
dorsia_reservations.samples: "Against All Odds" by Phil Collins, "Easy Lover" by Phil Collins, "One More Night" by Phil Collins, "Take Me Home" by Phil Collins

morning_routine.title: Morning Routine
morning_routine.description: Meticulous self-care with murderous precision. Two thousand stomach crunches and a flawless skincare regimen before the first kill of the day. Music for when personal grooming becomes performance art.
morning_routine.samples: "I Can't Go for That" by Hall & Oates, "Private Eyes" by Hall & Oates, "Rich Girl" by Hall & Oates, "Maneater" by Hall & Oates

champagne_cocaine.title: CHAMPAGNE & COCAINE
champagne_cocaine.description: Miami Vice Excess - Where Wall Street meets Scarface in powder-white suits

white_suit.title: White Suit Special
white_suit.description: Miami Vice swagger meets Wall Street ambition. Crockett and Tubbs closing deals on yachts while the synthesizers play. These tracks understand that sometimes the most profitable business is conducted in international waters.
white_suit.samples: "Crockett's Theme" by Jan Hammer, "Miami Vice Theme" by Jan Hammer, "Flashdance" by Irene Cara, "Maniac" by Michael Sembello

yacht_rock.title: Yacht Rock Portfolio
yacht_rock.description: Smooth sailing with offshore accounts. Corporate criminals with soft rock sensibilities and harder drug habits. Music for when your tax shelter has its own tax shelter and your boat is bigger than most people's houses.
yacht_rock.samples: "Sailing" by Christopher Cross, "Africa" by Toto, "Rosanna" by Toto, "What a Fool Believes" by The Doobie Brothers

scarface_suite.title: Scarface Corporate Suite
scarface_suite.description: When the world becomes yours through hostile acquisition. Tony Montana meets Gordon Gekko in marble-floored boardrooms. These tracks know that in America, you can have anything you want if you're willing to take it.
scarface_suite.samples: "Scarface (Push It to the Limit)" by Paul Engemann, "Rush Rush" by Debbie Harry, "She's on Fire" by Amy Holland, "Gina and Elvira" by Giorgio Moroder
